Class Elevator

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscie55.hw2.Elevator

  • public class Elevator
extends java.lang.Object
    Elevator class: move up and down, and talk with Building
    Version:
    1.0 March 1, 2016
    Author:
    Yuling (Alice) Xiong

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void boardPassenger(int floor)
      Adds to the Elevator a passenger destined for the indicated floor
      int currentFloor()
      Get currentFloor method, since currentFloor's access is private
      int getwaitQue(int floorNumber)
      getwaitQue method: waitQue's access is private, so we define this get method here
      void move()
      move method: Modifies the direction of travel, if the ground floor or top floor has been reached direction move up or down number of passengers in the elevator will be updated according to boardQue and waitQue We need take capacity into consideration.
      int passengers()
      Get passengers method, since passengers's access is private
      void updatewaitQue(int floorNumber)
      updatewaitQue method: each time this button is pressed, the waitQue[floorNumber] will increase by 1

        getwaitQue method: waitQue's access is private, so we define this get method here
        Parameters:
        floorNumber -
        Returns:

      • move

        public void move()
        move method: Modifies the direction of travel, if the ground floor or top floor has been reached direction move up or down number of passengers in the elevator will be updated according to boardQue and waitQue We need take capacity into consideration. If the calculated passengers>10, then we update waitQue[currentFloor] = Passengers - 10, and forces passengers = 10

      • currentFloor

        public int currentFloor()
        Get currentFloor method, since currentFloor's access is private
        Returns:
        the elevator's current floor number

      • passengers

        public int passengers()
        Get passengers method, since passengers's access is private
        Returns:
        the number of passengers currently on the elevator

      • boardPassenger

        public void boardPassenger(int floor)
                    throws ElevatorFullException
        Adds to the Elevator a passenger destined for the indicated floor
        Parameters:
        floor - passenger will be boarded at that floor
        Throws:
        ElevatorFullException
